p: Melissa officinalis, also called lemon balm, belongs to the Lamiaceae family. This plant has small white flowers during summer and leaves with a mild lemonÂ scent. This phytomedicine is used to ameliorate motivation and behavior in patients with dementia disorder ( 107). Anti-oxidant ( 110, 111), anti-depressant ( 112), anxiolytic ( 112), and anti-inflammatory ( 113) activities are attributed to this plant. The therapeutic effects of this herbal medicine are due to its main active constituents: triterpenes, phenolic acids, and flavonoids ( 114).
